intro: Syngonanthus bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored grass, is a species of flowering plant in the Poaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in areas with moist, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-toned appearance, with upper and lower leaf surfaces displaying different colors. It typically grows as a low, clump-forming perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Syngonanthus bicolor is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed sites.
